TopicTitle: The name of the Kerbal galaxy?

Articles.Content:
does the galaxy have a name? Kerby Way? something like that?

is there any Official Dev statement about the name of the galaxy? =)

thnaks
Kandromeda of course.
It's Kerbalaxy
"Squad" Haven't you seen the signposts everywhere?

Kandromeda of course.

*calls Nova*
Yes I'm glad the constant stream of K related words are continuing...

"Kerbol" is a "rogue star", floating in intergalactic space. It just happens to have a system of planets around it.

http://starchild.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/StarChild/questions/question29.html

*calls Nova*

Go ahead, Captain *not K*alawang

I see no reason why it couldn't be somewhere our own galaxy.

Galaxies are huge. Nothing ever written about them does their size justice.

Millions and millions of starts.

They could be 100,000 light years away, and still be in our galaxy.

"Kerbol" is a "rogue star", floating in intergalactic space. It just happens to have a system of planets around it.

http://starchild.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/StarChild/questions/question29.html

But it also has a milky way esque galaxy looking like thing around it and loads of stars near enough to be bright and visible.

But it also has a milky way esque galaxy looking like thing around it and loads of stars near enough to be bright and visible.

This is important, I agree. The Kerbol system is definitely part of a galaxy. Maybe it's "Kream Way".

I see no reason why it couldn't be somewhere our own galaxy.

Galaxies are huge. Nothing ever written about them does their size justice.

Millions and millions of starts.

They could be 100,000 light years away, and still be in our galaxy.

If not in our galaxy, then very likely in the rest of the universe. The sheer amount of galaxies, even if the universe isn't infinite, means that the Kerbals are out there. Maybe that's how Squad got the idea for the game, Jeb must of crashed near them and now they keep him for future update ideas.
It's located in multiple dimension called Hard-Drives

AFAIK there's no official name for the galaxy, or Kalaxy Also, it's not clear if the Kerbal system actually is part of a galaxy or just a star drifting on it's own.

Personally, I'd like the Kerbal system to be part of a series of around 10 other stars floating around a giant black hole near the centre. Small enough to be explorable, large enough to have variation in it.
And a black hole for unlucky Kerbals to fall in?

And a black hole for unlucky Kerbals to fall in?

Or knowing Jebediah, try to land on it..

Yes I'm glad the constant stream of K related words are continuing...

xD yeah.

Kerbosaurs got extint long before kerbals and kerbilization

Double post, oops.

Edited May 8, 2013 by OneRedBlock
I like the old Kreek name Kyklos Galaktikos...

If not in our galaxy, then very likely in the rest of the universe. The sheer amount of galaxies, even if the universe isn't infinite, means that the Kerbals are out there. Maybe that's how Squad got the idea for the game, Jeb must of crashed near them and now they keep him for future update ideas.

"Large pink mammals, I will call down a thousand discarded stages upon you if you don't let me go!"

--

In other news, I call the galaxy "Kerbos".
Leon, I said that before the forum crash.

[closed]

Edited July 4, 2021 by benjiful9000
Cleaning house

Leon, I said that before the forum crash.

I found and joined the forums after the crash so I don't know about some of the past discussions and what has been said. Sorry musicpenguin

Anything but Kerbsomething. Isn't it confusing enough with Kerbal, Kerbin, Kerbol?

How about plain old Galaxy K.

I'm happy with it being unnamed, or our own.

A galaxy is a ridiculously huge thing, and I suspect something that won't play a large role in the game.

Apart from background info, maybe.
